trans-unit.source: Scale pricing tier in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Scale pricing tier in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to scale Web, Mobile, API and Logic apps in Azure App Service, including autoscaling.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to scale Web, Mobile, API and Logic apps in Azure App Service, including autoscaling.

trans-unit.source: Scale pricing tier in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Scale pricing tier in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: For increased performance and throughput for your apps on Microsoft Azure, you can use the [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com/) to scale up your App Service plan from **Free** to **Shared**, **Basic**, **Standard**, or **Premium**.
trans-unit.target: For increased performance and throughput for your apps on Microsoft Azure, you can use the [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com/) to scale up your App Service plan from **Free** to **Shared**, **Basic**, **Standard**, or **Premium**.

trans-unit.source: The level of service your App Service plan has is based on the [*Pricing tier* for the plan](/pricing/details/app-service/).
trans-unit.target: The level of service your App Service plan has is based on the [*Pricing tier* for the plan](/pricing/details/app-service/).

trans-unit.source: Higher pricing tiers, like **Standard** and **Premium**, offer greater robustness and flexibility in determining how your resources on Azure are used.
trans-unit.target: Higher pricing tiers, like **Standard** and **Premium**, offer greater robustness and flexibility in determining how your resources on Azure are used.

trans-unit.source: Changing the pricing tier affects the number of cores and amount of memory your service has, and this is referred to as *Scaling up* (or *Scaling down*).
trans-unit.target: Changing the pricing tier affects the number of cores and amount of memory your service has, and this is referred to as *Scaling up* (or *Scaling down*).

trans-unit.source: In addition to scaling up the pricing tier, you can increase the number of instances that you service has.
trans-unit.target: In addition to scaling up the pricing tier, you can increase the number of instances that you service has.

trans-unit.source: This is referred to as *Scaling out* or *Scaling in*.
trans-unit.target: This is referred to as *Scaling out* or *Scaling in*.

trans-unit.source: See the article on [Scale instance count manually or automatically](../insights-how-to-scale.md) to learn more about *Scale out* and *Scale in*.
trans-unit.target: See the article on [Scale instance count manually or automatically](../insights-how-to-scale.md) to learn more about *Scale out* and *Scale in*.

trans-unit.source: For information about App Service plans, see [What is an App Service Plan?](../web-sites-web-hosting-plan-overview.md) and [Azure App Service Plans In-Depth Overview](azure-web-sites-web-hosting-plans-in-depth-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about App Service plans, see [What is an App Service Plan?](../web-sites-web-hosting-plan-overview.md) and [Azure App Service Plans In-Depth Overview](azure-web-sites-web-hosting-plans-in-depth-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: For information the pricing and features of individual App Service plans, see [App Service Pricing Details](/pricing/details/app-service/).
trans-unit.target: For information the pricing and features of individual App Service plans, see [App Service Pricing Details](/pricing/details/app-service/).

trans-unit.source: Finally, scaling works differently if you want to use a dedicated [App Service Environment](app-service-app-service-environment-intro.md).
trans-unit.target: Finally, scaling works differently if you want to use a dedicated [App Service Environment](app-service-app-service-environment-intro.md).

trans-unit.source: See [Scaling web apps in an App Service Environment](app-service-web-scale-a-web-app-in-an-app-service-environment.md) for more details.
trans-unit.target: See [Scaling web apps in an App Service Environment](app-service-web-scale-a-web-app-in-an-app-service-environment.md) for more details.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Before switching a from the **Free** mode to **Basic**, **Standard**, or **Premium** mode, you must first remove the spending caps in place for your Azure App Service subscription.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Before switching a from the **Free** mode to **Basic**, **Standard**, or **Premium** mode, you must first remove the spending caps in place for your Azure App Service subscription.

trans-unit.source: To view or change options for your Microsoft Azure App Service subscription, see [Microsoft Azure Subscriptions][azuresubscriptions].
trans-unit.target: To view or change options for your Microsoft Azure App Service subscription, see [Microsoft Azure Subscriptions][azuresubscriptions].

trans-unit.source: Scaling your pricing tier
trans-unit.target: Scaling your pricing tier

trans-unit.source: In your browser, open the [Azure Portal][portal] and browse to the app you want to scale.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, open the [Azure Portal][portal] and browse to the app you want to scale.

trans-unit.source: In the **Essentials** for your app, click the **App Service plan/pricing tier** link.
trans-unit.target: In the **Essentials** for your app, click the **App Service plan/pricing tier** link.

trans-unit.source: Click **Pricing tier**, then you will see the list of possible service levels for your plan.
trans-unit.target: Click **Pricing tier**, then you will see the list of possible service levels for your plan.

trans-unit.source: Each tier is accompanied by an estimated price, to give you a sense of the average cost for that tier.
trans-unit.target: Each tier is accompanied by an estimated price, to give you a sense of the average cost for that tier.

trans-unit.source: Choose Plan
trans-unit.target: Choose Plan

trans-unit.source: Once you choose your tier, click **Select**.
trans-unit.target: Once you choose your tier, click **Select**.

trans-unit.source: The **Notifications** tab will flash a green **SUCCESS** once the operation is complete.
trans-unit.target: The **Notifications** tab will flash a green **SUCCESS** once the operation is complete.

trans-unit.source: You can also learn about the different tiers of compute in Azure [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=309169).
trans-unit.target: You can also learn about the different tiers of compute in Azure [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=309169).

trans-unit.source: Scaling related resources
trans-unit.target: Scaling related resources

trans-unit.source: If your app depends on other services, such as SQL or Storage, you can also scale those based on your needs.
trans-unit.target: If your app depends on other services, such as SQL or Storage, you can also scale those based on your needs.

trans-unit.source: In the **Essentials**, click the **Resource group** link.
trans-unit.target: In the **Essentials**, click the **Resource group** link.

trans-unit.source: Then, in the **Summary** part of the resource group blade, clicked one of the databases (or any other resource you want to scale).
trans-unit.target: Then, in the **Summary** part of the resource group blade, clicked one of the databases (or any other resource you want to scale).

trans-unit.source: Linked database
trans-unit.target: Linked database

trans-unit.source: On that linked resource blade, click the **Pricing tier** part, select one of the tiers based on your performance requirements, and click **Select**.
trans-unit.target: On that linked resource blade, click the **Pricing tier** part, select one of the tiers based on your performance requirements, and click **Select**.

trans-unit.source: Scale your SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Scale your SQL Database

trans-unit.source: If your app uses Storage, geo replication is automatically set up when you choose a pricing tier that supports it.
trans-unit.target: If your app uses Storage, geo replication is automatically set up when you choose a pricing tier that supports it.

trans-unit.source: For SQL, on the other hand, you need to manually configure geo-replication to increase the high availability and disaster recovery capabilities of your SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: For SQL, on the other hand, you need to manually configure geo-replication to increase the high availability and disaster recovery capabilities of your SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: To do this, click the **Geo Replication** part.
trans-unit.target: To do this, click the **Geo Replication** part.

trans-unit.source: Set up geo-replication for SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Set up geo-replication for SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Developer Features
trans-unit.target: Developer Features

trans-unit.source: Depending on the pricing tier, the following developer-oriented features are available:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the pricing tier, the following developer-oriented features are available:

trans-unit.source: Bitness
trans-unit.target: Bitness

trans-unit.source: The **Basic**, **Standard**, and **Premium** tiers support 64-bit and 32-bit applications.
trans-unit.target: The **Basic**, **Standard**, and **Premium** tiers support 64-bit and 32-bit applications.

trans-unit.source: The **Free** and **Shared** plan tier support 32-bit applications only.
trans-unit.target: The **Free** and **Shared** plan tier support 32-bit applications only.

trans-unit.source: Debugger Support
trans-unit.target: Debugger Support

trans-unit.source: Debugger support is available for the **Free**, **Shared**, and **Basic** modes at 1 concurrent connection per App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: Debugger support is available for the **Free**, **Shared**, and **Basic** modes at 1 concurrent connection per App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: Debugger support is available for the **Standard** and **Premium** modes at 5 concurrent connections per App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: Debugger support is available for the **Standard** and **Premium** modes at 5 concurrent connections per App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: Other Features
trans-unit.target: Other Features

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about all of the remaining features in the App Service plans, including pricing and features of interest to all users (including developers), see [App Service Pricing Details](/pricing/details/web-sites/).
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about all of the remaining features in the App Service plans, including pricing and features of interest to all users (including developers), see [App Service Pricing Details](/pricing/details/web-sites/).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.target: To get started with Azure, see [Microsoft Azure Free Trial](/pricing/free-trial/).
